intro: Diplotaxis platystylis, commonly known as the broad-styled synbranch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in fine hairs. Diplotaxis platystylis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
